name: Holiday Inn Express Halifax / Bedford

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel one night. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.We had to leave early so we could not have the breakfast but our friends told us that the breakfast was good. The hotel is near the highway which makes it easy if you are traveling by a car.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights on our road trip to the Maritimes with children & parents. The rooms were clean & comfortable thanks to the efficient housekeeping staff. Breakfast was impressive with the ladies keeping up with the demand. Arrived early but Matt at the Front Desk was able to check us into one of the rooms. While we were getting our luggage in, he called to inform us of the availability of the 2nd room saving us the wait. Kids had a great time in the pool after a day of sightseeing. Really liked the laundry line in the bathtub which makes drying of swim things so much easier.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Holiday Inn was offering a reasonable cup of coffee for a while, called "Fancy Gourmet". Despite having a hillbilly-esque name, it wasn't bad. Lately though, the chain has started serving the worst swill I've had since my days in Cornwallis Boot Camp back in the 80s, made by "Mother Parkers". This creek water brown, faintly bitter and off-tasting "coffee" will leave you with the impression that the manager who chose this brand of coffee either hates coffee, or has complete contempt for his customers. Holiday Inn, I challenge you to start serving real coffee.
reviews.title: What happened to the Coffee?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice room, near Bedford and highway. We like staying here, as we travel to the south shore during our visits and it's perfect to be near the highway. Great front desk staff - always helpful with that maritime flair. Priority club members get a snack upon check-in. Rooms very nice, a/c works well, comfy beds. Breakfast included and typical express style. We asked for and received late check-out at no extra charge. We have stayed here a few times, every visit to Halifax, and we have never had an issue or complaint.
reviews.title: Always a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good hotel for the price.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the price

reviews.text: Arrived to our room to find the heater busted off the wall - which is quite unpleasant on a very cold very windy December night. Front Desk immediately switched us to the room next door. 2 days later the headboard fell off the wall in our new room. Front desk was very nice and concerned that we were all right (headboard slid behind bed and didnt hit my son who was laying 1/2 foot away).
reviews.title: Excellent service - good enough hotel

reviews.text: Service was 100% excellent. Breakfast was ok - really liked the bacon.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for... and then some!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, 6 month old daughter and I stay at the Holiday Inn Express (booked on Hotwire.ca) in August and it was great. This was the night before we were leaving to head back to Toronto from our 2 week East Coast trip. We stayed at the Westin in Halifax the first few nights... payed a LOT more and were extremely disappointed.
reviews.title: Hotel in Halifax.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Holiday Inn Express was fantastic. Internet and breakfast were included. Parking is free. Room was very modern and clean. It was close enough to everything as we had a rental car.
reviews.title: Good if a little expensive

reviews.text: I would go back and stay there again!
reviews.title: Nothing special...

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Bedford in June 2012. The hotel meet my expectations. It is the standard hotel quality type found throughout Atlantic Canada. Though a few updates have been made to the hotel since it first opened, don't expect trendy or industry leading decor/design. With expectations set, the hotel does offer a clean room and comfortable stay at an affordable rate for any family looking for value with a stress-free hotel. The beds were clean and provide a good sleep. The changeable duvet cover (now becoming standard in most North American hotels) is certainly a positive. One issue with the rooms: the thermostat controls are digital and can be confusing. It appeared there was little beyond the "auto" setting and for those of us wishing to sleep with the fan on, have to put up with the fan coming on and off throughout the night. The hotel does provide a great breakfast. There are hot food items available in the breakfast (ie. eggs, sausage, waffles) along with the standard continental items (ie. toast, cereal, yogurt). Located next to the hotel is a Tim Hortons, for those needing your familiar cup of coffee. The hotel does offer coin-operated laundry facilities and a small fitness room. All in all, our stay was enjoyable and we would return. I must make one point however. The pool area was a bit of disappointment. The pool liner appears to have been installed rather poorly and there were plenty of ants on the pool deck.
reviews.title: Clean & Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical H.I.X, which is not a bad thing! Big bedroom and bathroom, two nice prints on the walls (but only two). Noisy air conditioner, but a small, screened window could be opened 4", which allowed fresh air into the room. No desk, but two arm chairs and a round table were provided. We did NOT like the plastic cover on the mattress, which made us perspire all night. Good breakfast choices in a somewhat small, crowded breakfast area. About 9 km (6 miles) from downtown, with easy access.
reviews.title: Predictably Good

reviews.text: This is our favourite hotel, when visiting grandkids & family in the Bedford area. This visit was for 5 days and no negative surprises. Front desk staff ( Tristan & Matt ) were great and helpful as always. Rooms clean and neat thanks to Wendy our housekeeper for most of the time. The buffet breakfast was the usual HI fare but clean, filling and well presented.
reviews.title: Recommend as usual

reviews.text: It was like another visit to a friendly place. Not a 5-star but definitely a comfortable, clean place to "hang your hat" when in the area. Close to major shopping, restaurants and Halifax itself. The grandkids like to visit and use the pool facilities with us.
reviews.title: Nice Place - Nice Location

reviews.text: Recommend.
reviews.title: One of the nicest hotels I have stayed in

reviews.text: Stayed here for a night on return trip from sun holiday ... rooms spotlessly clean and check-in/out was a breeze. Also noted that they are a pet-friendly hotel - the staff was in the process of putting together dog bones and bags for their guests! Great idea! :)
reviews.title: Good Night's Sleep! :)

reviews.text: Breakfast was typical of Holiday Inn, a little something for everyone!
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: Good,clean and friendly staff and a typical Holiday inn (express) experience. Good beds and pillows for a sound night sleep with coffee maker in the room. Hotel is in Bedford, so a 20-25 min drive to downtown halifax but very easy to get on Hwy#2 and close to Tim Hortons,NSLC, gas stations etc.
reviews.title: At the middle of nowhere

reviews.text: Good and clean hotel. If you are looking for a quiet place at the middle of nowhere, this hotel is for you !
reviews.title: Great Value for a Great Stay

reviews.text: Good point : the give complimentary cookies (I wish they give coffee too). Even if I'm not a big fan of the location, I would recommend that hotel for someone who needs to stay by the airport.
reviews.title: Easy, clean, good value
